description: The official website of Liam and Gemma Walsh! All the updates! All the fun! :D

timeline.title: The morning
timeline.copy: Finally the day is here! The day of our wedding. The bride, bridemaids and mother of the bride awake early at the Worsley Marriott Hotel.

timeline.title: Everything laid out
timeline.copy: Everything was in place to start getting ready for the day to come.

timeline.title: The bridal preparation
timeline.copy: With the bridesmaids all done with makeup and dresses, the makeup artist turns to the bride to begin the makeup and hair that would dazzle the groom at the front of the aisle.

timeline.title: The bridemaid's get ready
timeline.copy: The bridesmaids receive their gifts from the bride and groom as a small thank you in advance for the role they all would play that day.

timeline.title: A little help
timeline.copy: All attention on getting the bride as ready as possible. Final adjustments from all around and the long process of lacing up the wedding dress falls to the chief bridesmaid.

timeline.title: Ready to dazzle
timeline.copy: Final adjustments made the bride is set to stun all.

timeline.title: The father arrives
timeline.copy: Shortly after the father of the bride arrives, no words can explain the emotions in the room.

timeline.title: A loving embrace
timeline.copy: A shared embrace as the father of the bride holds his eldest daughter soaking in the moment.

timeline.title: Ready to go
timeline.copy: With everyone ready and present, the bridal party begins to make their way to the church. Bridesmaids first followed by the bride and father.

timeline.title: The groomsmen arrive
timeline.copy: After a rocky start to the morning, with one car not starting and a whole load of traffic, the groom finally arrives with his best man and chief usher. The grandfather of the bride already present checking the order of service.

timeline.title: The scene is set
timeline.copy: Patricroft Methodist Church is ready for all as the guests start arriving. Lovely weather for the day to come.

timeline.title: Last minute tidy
timeline.copy: The groomsmens turn to tidy up and make those last minute adjustments. Each one fussing over the next.

timeline.title: All together
timeline.copy: Finally, altogether, some last few shots with the photographer before the bride arrives.

timeline.title: Brothers in arms
timeline.copy: The groom with his best man and brother share a moment, two brothers in a nutshell.

timeline.title: Groomsmen, man your posts!
timeline.copy: Suprisingly last minute the groomsmen head inside to the front of the aisle just as the bride pulls up.

timeline.title: The bride arrives
timeline.copy: Reliable Ruby got the bridal party here safe and sound.

timeline.title: Mind the step
timeline.copy: The chauffeur helps the bride out of the car, watch the step!

timeline.title: Are you ready?
timeline.copy: Everyone is at their post, one last check with the bride that everyone is ready. Smiles all around.

timeline.title: The guests await
timeline.copy: The two families gather and await the start of the ceremony.

timeline.title: The end of the aisle
timeline.copy: The groomsmen share a few quips to help settle each others nerves, feeling hot in the suits already.

timeline.title: The walk down the aisle
timeline.copy: The bridesmaids lead the bridal procession down the aisle. The bride accompanied with her father on her left and grandfather on her right. Everybody watches on.

timeline.title: We meet at last
timeline.copy: The moment at last, the long wait over, back together and soon forever. A shared smile and a silently stunned groom.

timeline.title: The ceremony
timeline.copy: The ceremony starts and the roof is lifted with the voices of all in joyous song.

timeline.title: The family have their say
timeline.copy: The youngest bridesmaid and sister of the bride shares a beautiful reading and the grandfather of the bride shares a heartfelt poem.

timeline.title: Adam remembered the rings!
timeline.copy: The best man steps up and delivers the rings, job number one done. The groom goes first, his brides delicate hand easily fits the ring.

timeline.title: The bride's turn
timeline.copy: She turns now to her future husband, his big clumsy hands fits the ring in the end, a cheeky grin.

timeline.title: The choir in full force
timeline.copy: All the guests raise the roof once more, the emotions start to show.

timeline.title: Sitting through the boring bit
timeline.copy: The groom, bride, chief bridesmaid and the best man get down to the legal business of signing the register as the guests turn to one another. The delight of the day shines through.

timeline.title: Signing the register
timeline.copy: The bride and groom sit down to do business, signatures signed and last minute spelling checks, everything is hunky dorey.

timeline.title: The best man seals the deal
timeline.copy: Handing the certificate over to the capable trusting hands of the best man he seals the deal, hope it doesn't go missing!

timeline.title: Together forever
timeline.copy: The contract is signed, the bride and groom soaking in the whole atmosphere. Finally together forever.

timeline.title: One final kiss then up the aisle
timeline.copy: Everyone wants to move on with things, the bride and groom just want that one last kiss before settings off. The bride making her way back up the aisle with her husband.

timeline.title: It was a bit warm in there
timeline.copy: A little surprise as the couple head outside, the groomsmen not the only ones suffering from the heat. A friend carrying an important package takes refuge near the outside for some fresh air.

timeline.title: Job done, hurrah!!!
timeline.copy: All the formalities done time to relax!

timeline.title: Well done guys!
timeline.copy: Everyone played their part, especially the chief bridesmaid and best man! The newly weds couldn't ask for better.

timeline.title: A fist full of confetti
timeline.copy: The newly weds showered with confetti, trying not to get any in the face!

timeline.title: The whole bunch
timeline.copy: All the guests line up for an amazing group photo, one for the photo album.

timeline.title: The best of friends
timeline.copy: All the friends jump in, everyone of them immaculately dressed.

timeline.title: The grooms horde
timeline.copy: Both of the grooms families, big in size and big in heart line up with the bride and groom.

timeline.title: All the Lambs
timeline.copy: A smaller bunch but no less special, the brides family showing how its done.

timeline.title: The whole party
timeline.copy: The best of both, the bridal party together.

timeline.title: The immediate family
timeline.copy: Some family portraits before the day continues, spaces on the walls of each house made available for these snaps.

timeline.title: The Lowry arrival
timeline.link: The Lowry greeted the newly weds
timeline.copy: A short trip in good ol' Ruby with a glass, or two, or three to kick things off. Someone should stop the groom, he isn't used to it.

timeline.title: The Lowry
timeline.copy: The staff at The Lowry were kind enough to let the driver all the way around to the front of the building for a photoshoot. The great Manchester swim was taking place on the Quays that day so many onlookers holl'd their congratulations.

timeline.title: Photoshoot with Ruby
timeline.copy: A pleasure to have the beautiful wedding car for some pictures, classy car for a classy couple. Friendly spectators send their best wishes.

timeline.title: The guests await
timeline.copy: Enough posing for pictures for now time to go and meet the guests again for some drinks. Accompanied by the best man for crowd control we make our way to the drinks reception in the Hexagon room.

timeline.title: The drinks reception
timeline.link: The guests arrived at The Lowry
timeline.copy: Fun rules set for the day as the bride eagerly takes another glass of bubbly, her fun has just begun! The groom gingerly takes another glass, by this point he's starting to feel warm inside and going a little blurry eyed, steady on! Got a speech and a special dance to come!

timeline.title: Settling in
timeline.copy: Everyone back together again in the Hexagon room taking the chance to speak to the bride and groom for the first time as husband and wife. Everyone in good spirits.

timeline.title: Having a good time
timeline.copy: The best man and chief usher posing for some photos, I wonder how many drinks they've had so far?

timeline.title: Could I have your autograph?
timeline.copy: Everyone is lining up to picture with the bride, her gorgeous dress a spectacle to all! Some of the young women from both families jump in on the act!

timeline.title: The Compass Room
timeline.link: We all sat down and ate
timeline.copy: The lights are up. The room is ready. The menu for the day traditional and rustic! The groom is bound to be pleased.

timeline.title: The tables are set
timeline.copy: Tables, plates and chairs set. The silverware polished to a shine, the chairs and tables decorated with splashes of pastel colours add some life.

timeline.title: The little things
timeline.copy: A place of rememberance for those sadly unable to join physically but there in spirit. A favor for everyone, seeds that will sow new life with some TLC a perfect metaphor for the occasion. Finally the cake, lovingly crafted by a friend, flower adorning each tier.

timeline.title: Goodbye Hexagon Room, hello Compass Room
timeline.copy: The guests finish making their way to the room to be followed shortly by the bride and groom where they will share their first meal as husband and wife.

timeline.title: Everyone seated
timeline.copy: Everyone finds their places and settles down, getting napkins at the ready it's been quite a day so far.

timeline.title: The big entrance
timeline.copy: And here we come, hand in arm, we can't quite believe what we're seeing either, the room impeccably set.

timeline.title: Time to eat
timeline.copy: Arguably the grooms favourite part of the day! Starting of with plenty of bread and butter accompanied by soup, followed by rustic roasted chicken and capped off with the brides favourite... creme brulee... all delicious.

timeline.title: The father kicks things off
timeline.link: The groomsmen took to the stage
timeline.copy: Bellies full and thirsts quenched, the brave father of the bride makes a stand to commence the speeches.

timeline.title: The emotions creep through
timeline.copy: A loving and emotional speech from the father to both daughter and new son, it was hard for anyone not to cry at the intense love behind the words.

timeline.title: The grooms turn
timeline.copy: The grooms turn to prove himself. Many thanks, praises and mentions are noted. The organisers bring forth flowers to all the lovely mothers of the families, truly they deserved every rose.

timeline.title: Was it something I said?
timeline.copy: A quip or two amongst the role call of thanks, the character of the groom clearly on show.

timeline.title: To my beautiful wife
timeline.copy: The groom turns to the bride to make note of the dazzling dress and the splendid smile. He tries valiantly to express his emotions so that all might understand what she means to him.

timeline.title: The room listens
timeline.copy: The room hanging on every word, the groomsmen are doing their duty, a captivated audience from beginning to end.

timeline.title: The bridesmaids holding it together?
timeline.copy: The groom is coming to the end, he makes special note of the stunning bridesmaids and how helpful they've all been. The youngest one can't handle the emotion when the groom mentions her and how she'd changed since they first met.

timeline.title: The best mans turn
timeline.copy: Grooms part is over, he can relax now, time for the best man to steal the show. Not afraid of outdoing himself he takes to the floor. A natural, confident man... the best man.

timeline.title: Laughter is contagious
timeline.copy: A tale or two shared and plenty of jokes but nothing was funny about the emotion he showed. He owned the stage, indeed he stole the show.

timeline.title: A job well done, best man was the best
timeline.copy: Everyone finished and a long beloved brother and sister hold each other close. They've grown as a pair too, not just the bride with the groom.

timeline.title: Taking in the scenery
timeline.link: The couple disappeared for a while
timeline.copy: They went down and outside to get some fresh air, to pose for more photos while the Quays were bare. Amazing scenery all around.

timeline.title: The fantastic four
timeline.copy: Photos finished, the newly weds and their chiefs head back to kick off the party!

timeline.title: Just a quick practice
timeline.copy: One last moment before its real, the bride and groom prepare for the first dance to come.

timeline.title: People are getting hungry for cake!
timeline.copy: Everybody sat waiting, hungry for cake and eager for the newly weds to return.

timeline.title: Some friendly faces
timeline.copy: Friends and family, old and young alike, mingle, mixing well, the perfect concoction for happiness.

timeline.title: Cutting the cake
timeline.copy: Here we are, Manchester United's football ground on view for the reds! About to cut the cake... 5... 4... 3... 2... 1...

timeline.title: I'm sorry Cakey!!!
timeline.copy: Like a hot knife through butter, we cut the cake, the baker screams intently inside whilst smiling to hide the pain. Done together, the groom at least had someone watching him cut.

timeline.title: The first dance
timeline.link: The couple had their first dance
timeline.copy: The moment the bride and groom have been practicing for so long. She takes a seat awaiting the hand of her gent. They start to dance, sweeping across the floor to the chords of Norah Jones, Come Away With Me.

timeline.title: Nailed it!
timeline.copy: Only one little trip but nobody noticed, or nobody minded. The couple flood what is left of the tears from peoples eyes. Yep, we nailed it!

timeline.title: The party begins!
timeline.copy: Now everyone joins in, party has officially started! Dancing of all kinds! Dad dancing, break dancing, raptor dancing and the odd knee slide.

timeline.title: The joy of the dance
timeline.copy: Everyone is up, even those who normally don't! Caught on camera, yes you did enjoy yourself! Everyone in the spirit of the moment.

timeline.title: Colourful people
timeline.copy: So many people, all very unique, a dancing diva and a jolly old pirate?

timeline.title: The chief usher, the baker and the warrior princess!
timeline.copy: The best expresions caught on camera, they might be reacting to the grooms party dancing!

timeline.title: Duties over! Lets dance!
timeline.copy: The bride and the chief pose for one last picture before letting the rhythm of the music take its toll.
